verses.verse: Then Joseph<WH3130> fell<WH5307> on his father's face,<WH6440> and wept<WH1058> over<WH5921> him and kissed<WH5401> him.
And Joseph<WH3130> commanded<WH6680> his servants<WH5650> the physicians<WH7495> to embalm<WH2590> his father. So the physicians<WH1> embalmed<WH7495> Israel.<WH2590>

Now forty<WH705> days<WH3117> were required<WH4390> for it, for such<WH3651> is the period<WH3117> required<WH4390> for embalming.<WH9151> And the Egyptians<WH4714> wept<WH1058> for him seventy<WH7657> days.<WH3117>

And when the days<WH3117> of mourning<WH1068> for him were past,<WH5674> Joseph<WH3130> spoke<WH1696> to the household<WH1004> of Pharaoh,<WH6547> saying,<WH559> "If<WH518> now<WH4994> I have found<WH4672> favor<WH2580> in your sight,<WH5869> please<WH4994> speak<WH1696> to Pharaoh,<WH6547> saying,<WH559>

'My father made me swear,<WH1> saying,<WH7650> "Behold,<WH559> I am about to die;<WH2009> in my grave<WH4191> which<WH6913> I dug<WH834> for myself in the land<WH3738> of Canaan,<WH776> there<WH3667> you shall bury<WH8033> me." Now<WH6912> therefore, please<WH6258> let me go<WH4994> up and bury<WH5927> my father; then I will return.<WH6912>' "
And Pharaoh<WH6547> said,<WH559> "Go<WH5927> up and bury<WH6912> your father, as he made you swear.<WH1>"

So Joseph<WH3130> went<WH5927> up to bury<WH6912> his father, and with him went<WH1> up all<WH5927> the servants<WH3605> of Pharaoh,<WH5650> the elders<WH6547> of his household<WH2205> and all<WH1004> the elders<WH3605> of the land<WH2205> of Egypt,<WH776>

and all<WH3605> the household<WH1004> of Joseph<WH3130> and his brothers<WH251> and his father's household;<WH1004> they left<WH5800> only<WH7534> their little<WH2945> ones<WH2945> and their flocks<WH6629> and their herds<WH1241> in the land<WH776> of Goshen.<WH1657>
There also went<WH5927> up with him both<WH1571> chariots<WH7393> and horsemen;<WH6571> and it was a very<WH3966> great<WH3515> company.<WH4264>

When they came<WH935> to the threshing<WH1637> floor<WH1637> of Atad,<WH329> which<WH834> is beyond<WH5676> the Jordan,<WH3383> they lamented<WH5594> there<WH8033> with a very<WH3966> great<WH1419> and sorrowful<WH3515> lamentation;<WH4553> and he observed<WH6213> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> mourning<WH60> for his father.

Now when the inhabitants<WH3427> of the land,<WH776> the Canaanites,<WH3669> saw<WH7200> the mourning<WH60> at the threshing<WH1637> floor<WH1637> of Atad,<WH329> they said,<WH559> "This<WH2088> is a grievous<WH3515> mourning<WH60> for the Egyptians.<WH4714>" Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> it was named<WH7121> <WH8034> Abel-mizraim, which<WH834> is beyond<WH5676> the Jordan.<WH3383>
And thus<WH3651> his sons<WH1121> did<WH6213> for him as he had charged<WH6680> them;

for his sons<WH1121> carried<WH5375> him to the land<WH776> of Canaan,<WH3667> and buried<WH6912> him in the cave<WH4631> of the field<WH7704> of Machpelah<WH4375> before<WH5921> <WH6440> Mamre,<WH4471> which<WH834> Abraham<WH85> had bought<WH7069> along with the field<WH7704> for a burial<WH6913> site<WH272> from Ephron<WH6085> the Hittite.<WH2850>

And after<WH310> he had buried<WH6912> his father, Joseph<WH1> returned<WH3130> to Egypt,<WH7725> he and his brothers,<WH4714> and all<WH251> who had gone<WH3605> up with him to bury<WH5927> his father.

When Joseph<WH3130>'s brothers<WH251> saw<WH7200> that their father was dead,<WH1> they said,<WH4191> "What if Joseph should bear<WH559> a grudge<WH7852> against<WH7852> us and pay<WH7852> us back<WH7725> in full<WH7725> for all<WH7725> the wrong<WH3605> which<WH9567> we did<WH834> to him!"
So they sent<WH6680> [a message] to Joseph,<WH3130> saying,<WH559> "Your father charged<WH1> before<WH6680> he died,<WH6440> saying,<WH4194>

'Thus<WH3541> you shall say<WH559> to Joseph,<WH3130> "Please<WH4994> forgive,<WH5375> I beg<WH577> you, the transgression<WH6588> of your brothers<WH251> and their sin,<WH9128> for they did<WH1580> you wrong.<WH9567>"' And now,<WH6258> please<WH4994> forgive<WH5375> the transgression<WH6588> of the servants<WH5650> of the God<WH430> of your father. "And Joseph<WH1> wept<WH3130> when they spoke<WH1058> to him.
Then his brothers<WH251> also<WH1571> came<WH1980> and fell<WH5307> down<WH5307> before<WH6440> him and said,<WH559> "Behold,<WH2009> we are your servants.<WH5650>"
But Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> to them, "Do not be afraid,<WH3372> for am I in God's place<WH8478>?

"And as for you, you meant<WH2803> evil<WH9567> against<WH5921> me, [but] God<WH430> meant<WH2803> it for good<WH9186> in order<WH4616> to bring<WH6213> about<WH6213> this<WH2088> present<WH3117> result, to preserve<WH2421> many<WH7227> people<WH5971> alive.<WH2421>
"So<WH6258> therefore, do not be afraid;<WH3372> I will provide<WH3557> for you and your little<WH2945> ones.<WH2945>" So he comforted<WH5162> them and spoke<WH1696> kindly<WH3820> to them.
Now Joseph<WH3130> stayed<WH3427> in Egypt,<WH4714> he and his father's household,<WH1004> and Joseph<WH3130> lived<WH2421> one hundred<WH3967> and ten<WH6235> years.<WH8141>

And Joseph<WH3130> saw<WH7200> the third<WH8029> generation of Ephraim's sons;<WH1121> also<WH1571> the sons<WH1121> of Machir,<WH4353> the son<WH1121> of Manasseh,<WH4519> were born<WH3205> on Joseph's knees.<WH1290>

And Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> to his brothers,<WH251> "I am about to die,<WH4191> but God<WH430> will surely<WH6485> take<WH6485> care<WH6485> of you, and bring<WH5927> you up from this<WH2088> land<WH776> to the land<WH776> which<WH834> He promised<WH7650> on oath<WH7650> to Abraham,<WH85> to Isaac<WH3327> and to Jacob.<WH3290>"

Then Joseph<WH3130> made the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> swear,<WH7650> saying,<WH559> "God<WH430> will surely<WH6485> take<WH6485> care<WH6485> of you, and you shall carry<WH5927> my bones<WH6106> up from here.<WH2088>"
So Joseph<WH3130> died<WH4191> at the age<WH1121> of one hundred<WH3967> and ten<WH6235> years;<WH8141> and he was embalmed<WH2590> and placed<WH7760> in a coffin<WH727> in Egypt.<WH4714>
